string.name: notifying_service_controller
string.b: This service will update a status bar notification every 15 seconds for a minute

resources.string: Note: Please Hit On Bubble To View Details
Note: Please Select Menu >> Catalogs To Find Mobeegal Results
No Query to Modify \nPlease Fill New Query
Query Not Found Please Create New\nQuery To Find Mobeegal Result
Specify the partner profile: This will help others to have some idea of what you want. Please fill all the fields that are an absolutely must and desirable.

Fill Your Profile :
Filling your profile is done after selecting a catalog. There are 2 profiles that you can fill inside a catalog. The profiles are represented in a tab view. The first tab is called “iStuff” which means your profile.

Fill Your Target Profile :
Filling your target profile is done after selecting a catalog. There are 2 profiles that you can fill inside a catalog. The profiles are represented in a tab view. The second tab is called “mStuff” which means your match profile.

Activate Service :
To search using mobeegal, the mobeegal service in your mobile needs to be activated. To activate the service, hit the “Settings” menu. In the settings screen, there'll be a button named “Activate Service”. Push this button to start the service. Thats it. Now mobeegal will begin searching for the perfect match. So to recap,to do a mobeegal search, you need to Fill your profile (iStuff) Fill target profile (uStuff) Activate Service

1.My Profile
- again, care to explain? My Profile is what the user is. This is the criteria that the user uses to describes his stuff. Ex: In a Dating scenario, MyProfile would be your age, height, weight etc.,

2.Target Profile
- what is this? Target profile is what the user wants. This is the criteria that the user is looking for in his match. Ex: In a Dating scenario, TargetProfile would be your partners age, height, weight etc.,

3.Match
- can you explain? Match is something that you wanted and is retrieved from the match result. The mobeegal server given your search Query, will find relevant Match results and return to the mobile. The server will return most probably a collection of Match results.

4.Will there be User registration?
No. mobeegal will be completely stateless and anonymous as far as the User is concerned.

5.Is mobeegal Secure?
Yes. All requests are encrypted for maximum User security.

6.Is mobeegal Private?
Yes. Private information will never ever be send to the mobeegal server. Only the public information is shared with his matches.

7.How can I search?
The User fills MyProfile and TargetProfile for whatever catalog that he cares. Now the search can begin.

>8.Do I need to activate the Service to search?
Yes. The service must be activated for search. The service will send the Query to the server only after its activated.

9.How many service runs in mobeegal client?
Exactly one.

10. Does the Service send the Query with every request to the Server?
No. The Service will be smart enough to send it only once. If the Query has not changed, any future service request might just be a ping to the server to retrieve only the Match results.

11.Do I need to fill both MyProfile and TargetProfile for searching?
Yes. Filling both MyProfile and TargetProfile will be required for search. Just like you need a search query for searching, mobeegal requires the profiles to be filled which will included in your search criteria to bring you the relevant Match results.

12.Can I have multiple Search Profiles filled up?
Yes. Any number of Search profiles can be filled for as many catalogs as the User likes. All Search queries will be bundled into exactly one Query.

13.Can I search more than 1 catalog?
Yes, More than one catalog will be available for searching. Multiple profiles will be send as a single Query which will span multiple catalogs.

14.Can I filter the Match results?
Yes. You can filter the Matches by catalogs. There will be a search button and a filter drop down available in your Match result views.

15. Can I search within the Match results?
Yes. A search box will be provided to search within the Match results.

16. Is there more than one way of looking at my Match results?
The user can switch between text mode and map mode for viewing the Match results. The search and filter widget will be available for both modes of viewing.

17.How do I activate the Service?
The User can hit the menu, go to settings. Activate/De-Activate Service is available here.

18.Where do I store my Preferences?
The User can hit the menu, go to settings. Preferences button is available here. This would take the User to a separate screen to store the User preferences.

Alerts :
A Dating notifier will run along with the Dating service. This notifier will alert you of all dating matches found. The dating alert will specify Proximity and the Closeness of the Match. The Dating alert will use LBS, Maps and all kinds of locational api's to interact with you.

Interaction :
You can interact with the matches in your own way. You can select one or more matches and communicate with the match in an anonymous way. You can save all the matching profiles in your mobile device locally for future communication. Also you can delete this matching information at anytime.

Location Broadcast :
The dating service will be broadcasting your locations to the dating server when you are on move. This location information need not be sent, if you don't want. The polling interval can be set by you to broadcast your location every 5 minutes and you can also totally turn off this feature.
